page.title: 07The Viking Way
page.content: The Spa trail takes up most of the Viking Way in our area. It runs by the Horncastle canal that is no longer used but has ducks and is used for fishing. The walk can be done in about 20 minutes, but it is worth taking your time to see the pretty views and the wild life. By Thornton Lodge we saw cattle that we learned were Charolais from France and Chianina from Italy crossed with Ludlow Reds. These give very good beef. They grow clover on the farm for cattle feed and we found a lot had gone on the path and it was a good place to lucky four leafed ones. Some parts of the walk are very wide with plenty of space. Other parts were closed in by bushes and trees and we could imagine the original Viking traders trudging along the land.
